description: Find dependency issues in your Python project.

--config.description: Path to the pyproject.toml file to read configuration from.

--no-ansi.description: Disable ANSI characters in terminal output.

-i.description: A comma-separated list of error codes to ignore...

-pri.description: A comma-separated mapping of packages or modules to be ignored per error code...

-e.description: A regular expression for directories or files... [default: venv, \.venv, \.direnv, tests, \.git, setup\.py]

-ee.description: Like --exclude, but adds additional files and directories...

-nb.description: Boolean flag to specify if notebooks should be ignored while scanning for imports.

--version.description: Display the current version and exit.

-rf.description: .txt files to scan for dependencies... [default: requirements.txt]

-rfd.description: .txt files to scan for additional development dependencies... [default: dev-requirements.txt, requirements-dev.txt]

-kf.description: Modules to consider as first party ones.

-o.description: If specified, a summary of the dependency issues found will be written...

-pmnm.description: Manually defined module names belonging to packages...

-ddg.description: For projects that use PEP621... specify which groups under [project.optional-dependencies]... should be considered development dependencies.

--experimental-namespace-package.description: Enable experimental support for namespace package (PEP 420)...

ROOT.name: ROOT
ROOT.description: Path(s) to the root directory(s) of the project to be scanned.
